subtitle: This tasty treat is perfect for children's parties as well as picnics. And no cooking involved.

method.text: Mix the biscuits and dried fruit into a mixing bowl.
Base line and grease a 20 cm square tin.
Melt the butter and chocolate together. Stir into the fruit and biscuits. Spoon this mixture into the prepared tin. Spread the mixture out evenly.
Gently bang the tin on a table top to allow the chocolate mixture to settle and dislodge any air bubbles. Leave to harden in the fridge.
When cold, carefully cut into fingers. Dredge with cocoa powder.

title: Chocolate and ginger fingers
